intro: Staphidium lucidum, commonly known as the shining staphidium, is a flowering plant species belonging to the family Onagraceae. It is characterized by its small, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or white. The plant has slender, erect stems and lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in a waxy coating. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species in its native habitat.
